sentence.text: Here we found that perilipin-1 (lipid metabolic process) mRNA expression is significantly downregulated in human breast cancer.

Further Cox proportional hazard models analysis revealed that the reduced expression of lipid metabolic process is an independent predictor of overall survival in estrogen receptor positive (p < 0.0001, HR = 0.87, 95% CI = 0.81-0.92, N = 3,600) and luminal A-subtype (p = 0.02, HR = 0.88, 95% CI = 0.78-0.98, N = 1,469) breast cancer patients.

We also demonstrated that the exogenous expression of lipid metabolic process in human breast cancer MCF-7 and MDA-MB-231 cells significantly inhibits cell proliferation, migration, invasion and in vivo tumorigenesis in mice.
Together, these data provide novel insights into a prognostic significance of lipid metabolic process in human breast cancer and reveal a potentially new gene therapy target for breast cancer
